p: In contrast to the C4–C5 epoxy group in enhydrin ( 1), polymatin A ( 2) presents a double bond ( Fig. 1). C4–C5 epoxy groups in melampolides such as enhydrin have been reported to hinder the ability of these compounds to inhibit NF-κB DNA binding responsible to cytokines expression ( Schorr et al., 2007) commonly observed in inflammatory response. Conversely, the effect is favored by the presence of a double bond between C-4–C-5 in other melampolides ( Schorr et al., 2007). Hence, hopeful results could be expected in future studies to explore anti-inflammatory activity in polymatin A.
